subject: RE: Simplest hash initialization with no value
body:
Jeff,

Just another doubt -
	
Why it gives syntax error when -
	my @myhash{qw/A B/} = ();

It works when I say -
	my %myhash ;
	@myhash{qw/A B/} = ();	 

Thanks
Alok

-----Original Message-----
From: Jeff Pang [mailto:pangj@earthlink.net] 
Sent: Friday, June 01, 2007 3:21 PM
To: Nath, Alok (STSD)
Cc: beginners@perl.org
Subject: Re: Simplest hash initialization with no value

Nath, Alok (STSD) $B Hi,
> 	What is the simplest way to initialize the hash keys with no values ?
> 
> 	I know the crude form :
> 
> 	%myhash =('A' => undef,
> 		    'B' => undef) ;
> 
> 	Is there anything simpler than this ?
> Thanks,
> Alok
> 

Maybe you want,

@myhash{qw/A B/} = ();

--
http://home.arcor.de/jeffpang/
